metadata.title: Lockd | Trustless Value Transfer, Secured by Blockchain
metadata.description: Lock crypto for payments, inheritance, or any commitment that matters. No banks, no lawyers, no middlemen. Just smart contracts that execute exactly as programmed.
metadata.ogDescription: Lock value. Guaranteed by blockchain. For payments, inheritance, or any commitment that matters.

home.heading: Lock value.
home.subheading: No banks. No lawyers. No middlemen. Smart contracts that execute exactly as programmed—for payments, inheritance, or any commitment that matters.
home.problem1Desc: Sending crypto to someone who doesn't have a wallet yet? Hope they figure it out before you need those funds back.
home.problem2Desc: Want your family to inherit your crypto if something happens? Good luck explaining private keys to your loved ones.
home.problem3Desc: Making a payment or deal? Either trust the other party completely, or risk losing everything.
home.problemsSolution: Lockd removes trust from the equation.
home.paymentsDesc: Send crypto with automatic refund protection. Set a deadline—recipient claims or you get it back. Perfect for freelance work, bounties, gifts, and P2P deals.
home.inheritanceDesc: Set up crypto inheritance with a dead man's switch. Check in periodically to prove you're active. If you don't, your assets go to the right people.
home.certifyDesc: Create tamper-proof proof that a file existed at a specific time. Hash stored on-chain, file stays private. Perfect for IP, contracts, and evidence.
home.step1Desc: Lock ETH or tokens with a recipient and deadline
home.step2Desc: Recipient claims anytime by connecting their wallet

step1.title: Lock Funds
step1.description: Lock ETH or any ERC20 token for a specific recipient address. Set a deadline for claiming.

step2.title: Share the Link
step2.description: Send the claim link to your recipient. They can claim anytime before or after the deadline.

step3.title: Claim or Refund
step3.description: Recipient claims the funds, or you reclaim them after the deadline. You're always protected.

features.title: Built for Trust
features.subtitle: Security and simplicity at the core

trustless.title: Trustless
trustless.description: No middleman, purely on-chain smart contracts

multiToken.title: Multi-Token
multiToken.description: Supports ETH and any ERC20 token

useCases.title: Built for Real-World Problems
useCases.subtitle: Whether you're paying a freelancer, sending a gift, or making an offer — Lockd has you covered

freelance.title: Freelance Payments
freelance.description: Lock payment for a designer or developer. They claim when work is delivered. If not delivered, refund after deadline.
freelance.example: Pay 500 USDC for a logo design

bounties.title: Bounties & Rewards
bounties.description: Lock a bounty for whoever fixes a bug or completes a task. Assign it to the contributor who delivers.

p2p.title: P2P Offers
p2p.description: Make a trustless offer for an NFT or service. Seller claims to accept the deal, or you reclaim your funds.
p2p.example: Offer 2 ETH for a rare NFT

gifts.title: Crypto Gifts
gifts.description: Send birthday ETH to a friend. If they don't set up a wallet in time, reclaim it after the deadline.

invoices.title: Invoice Payments
invoices.description: Send an invoice link. Client deposits the payment, you claim upon delivering the service.

escrow.title: Escrow Agreements
escrow.description: Lock funds for any conditional agreement. The recipient claims when conditions are met.

cta.title: Ready to lock crypto with confidence?
cta.subtitle: Start using Lockd today. No signup required, just connect your wallet.

connectWallet.title: Connect Your Wallet
connectWallet.description: Connect your wallet to lock funds, claim, or view your history.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.description: Lock funds, claim, or manage your history.

createDeposit.title: Create a Deposit
createDeposit.description: Lock funds for a specific recipient. They can claim anytime, or you can refund after the deadline.
createDeposit.messagePlaceholder: e.g. Payment for logo design, Birthday gift, Bug bounty reward...
createDeposit.invalidTokenAddress: Please enter a valid contract address
createDeposit.startTimeHint: The recipient will not be able to claim before this date.
createDeposit.infoText: The recipient can claim these funds at any time. After the deadline, you can refund the funds if unclaimed.
createDeposit.infoTextWithStartTime: The recipient can claim these funds starting from the scheduled date. After the deadline, you can refund the funds if unclaimed.
createDeposit.successDescription: Share the claim link with your recipient.

sentDeposits.emptyDescription: Deposits you create will appear here. You can refund them after the deadline.

receivedDeposits.emptyDescription: When someone creates a deposit for your address, it will appear here.

notFound.title: Deposit Not Found
notFound.description: This deposit does not exist or the link is invalid.

alreadyClaimed.title: Already Claimed
alreadyClaimed.description: This deposit has already been claimed or refunded.

claimPage.sentViaClaimable: Someone has sent you crypto via Claimable
claimPage.wrongAddress: This deposit is for a different address. Connect with {address} to claim.
claimPage.fundsToWallet: The funds have been sent to your wallet.
claimPage.deadlineNote: After the deadline, the sender can reclaim these funds if unclaimed.

certify.title: Certify Files
certify.description: Create immutable proof that a file existed at a specific point in time. Your file never leaves your device.
certify.certifyDescription: Upload a file to compute its hash and store it on-chain as proof of existence.
certify.verifyDescription: Check if a file has been previously certified by uploading it or entering its hash.
certify.dragOrClick: Drag & drop a file, or click to select
certify.fileNeverUploaded: Your file is hashed locally and never uploaded
certify.certifyNote: Once certified, this hash will be permanently recorded on the blockchain.
certify.certificationSuccessDesc: Your file hash has been permanently recorded on the blockchain.
certify.connectWalletToCertify: Connect your wallet to certify files
certify.contractNotConfigured: Certification contract not available on this network
certify.notFoundDesc: This file hash has not been certified on the blockchain.
certify.howItWorks1: Your file is hashed locally using SHA-256. The file never leaves your device.
certify.howItWorks2: The hash is stored on the blockchain with your wallet address and timestamp.
certify.howItWorks3: Anyone can verify a file by computing its hash and checking if it exists on-chain.
